revision.comment: posted from my Linksys W-series model R sub-revision T5 clade 4 species G version 5 series point-Oh (possibly a lie)
revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=Motorola |model=SB6141 |revision= |upc=612572196199 |asin=B00AJHDZSI |est_release_date=2012 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |type=cable modem |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=0.75 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=2.5 |cpu1_brand=Texas Instruments |cpu1_model=TNETC4830;P5M, TNETC4830ZDWG, 1AAE7ZW; |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L6445EMI-10G |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W9725G6JB-25 |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Realtek |eth_chip2_model=RTL8211EG;RTL8211EG, B7E18P1 GB31B; |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |flags=DOCSIS 3.0 |stock_boot=U-Boot;1.2.0;vendor modified; |stock_os=Linux;2.6.18; |default_ip=192.168.100.1 }} '''Motorola SB6141 SURFboard DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem''' This device uses a maximum of 8 downstream and 4 upstream channels.
It [http://www.dslreports.com/forum/remark,27586890 has been remarked as using TNETC4840], but, per the below Wiki link,
at least some 6141s appear to use TNETC4830ZDWG.{{CableModemSpec |down_c=8 |up_c=4 }} As this modem is now sold by the '''ARRIS''' group, though still under the '''SURFboard''' brand. New product SKUs will likely differ. :The UPC of the new SKU seems to be 612572211175, as indicated by a wiki user. [https://wikidevi.wi-cat.ru/w/index.php?title=Motorola_SURFboard_SB6141&diff=176145&oldid=170467] ==Additional external links== *[http://sb6141.wikia.com/wiki/SB6141_Wiki Info @ the '''SB6141 Wikia'''] (w/ a link to board shots on imgur) :"SB6141 MAIN BOARD", "SB1557-001 REV: 3", "18-MAY-2011", the '''Motorola''' logo, :"MADE IN TAIWAN", and a date code of '''1146''' is silkscreened on the board shown. :P/Ns used in this entry are per this wiki page. *[http://sourceforge.net/projects/sb6141.arris/ SB6141 OSS Code @ '''SourceForge'''] (linked from above wiki) :This modem was apparently code named '''Komodo'''. :The GPL tarball contains a modified Linux 2.6.18 kernel as well as U-Boot 1.2.0. :It can probably be safely assumed they are used, so they are specified in this wiki entry. ==Likely compatible services== *{{Approved by service|Comcast}} ([http://mydeviceinfo.comcast.net/device.php?devid=336 '''Comcast''' device database entry]) *{{Approved by service|Time Warner}} ([http://www.timewarnercable.com/content/dam/residential/pdfs/support/internet/buy-or-lease-your-modem/MOTOROLA_SB6141_UserGuide.pdf User Guide] | [http://www.timewarnercable.com/content/dam/residential/pdfs/support/internet/buy-or-lease-your-modem/MOTOROLA_SB6141_QSG.pdf Quick Start Guide] :[http://www.timewarnercable.com/content/dam/residential/pdfs/support/internet/twc-compatible-modems.pdf List of Time Warner approved modems]) __NOTOC__
